intro: Commelinopsis rufipes, commonly known as the red-hair grass, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Commelinaceae, which includes many ornamental and grass-like plants. The plant is characterized by its slender, grass-like leaves and small, clustered inflorescences. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests or wetlands. Its unique reddish-pubescent stems and foliage make it a distinctive species within its native habitat.
